div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 958 Marasesti, c. 73 km. NW of Galati, (646) Rumania, 1909 Burial: early 1st cent. B.C. (Mitrea) Contents: c. 800 AV. Pot hoard Philip II: 4 st. Alexander III: 64 lifetime and post. st. (Amphipolis 7, Lysimacheia? 1, Lamp- sacus 6, Abydus 6, Miletus 4, Aradus 2,Sidon 1, Ace 1, Babylon 8, Callatis 14, Odessus 7, unc. 7) Philip III: 2 st. (Abydus 1, Aradus 1) Lysimachus: 11 lifetime st. (Lysimacheia 3, Lampsacus 1, Abydus 2, Alex- andreia Troas 4, unc. 1) 7 post. st. (Tomis 2, Cal- latis 2, Byzantium 2, unc. 1) Disposition: New York 23; Vienna, Berlin, Paris some; Bucharest (Acad.) 1 Alex- ander and 79 casts â€ Moisil, BSNR 11 (1914), pp. 25-6; CNA 14 (1939), pp. 142-3 Iliescu, Caiet selectiv 8 (1963), p. 329 (1 Alex- ander) Newell's record of coins he had seen supplemented by information from B. Mitrea
